title: Add additional selectable particle types for the Hero theme

requirements.text: Extend the hero theme particle effect type options so admins can select additional particle types beyond the current set, and persist the chosen type as part of `HeroSectionTheme.particleEffect.effectType`.

quotes: Add more particles types in the hero section theme to select.

acceptanceCriteria: Backend `ParticleEffectType` supports additional variants (new selectable particle types) without breaking existing stored hero theme data.
Frontend type generation remains consistent (the new variants are available in the generated `frontend/src/backend` types and compile successfully).
The default hero theme remains valid and unchanged unless explicitly updated by the admin.

requirements.text: Update the Admin Hero Theme Manager particle type selector to include the newly added particle effect types, with clear English labels, and ensure the currently saved type is correctly shown/selected when reloading the admin page.

quotes: Add more particles types in the hero section theme to select.

acceptanceCriteria: The "Particle Type" dropdown in `frontend/src/components/admin/HeroThemeManager.tsx` shows the full list of supported particle types (existing + newly added).
Saving the hero theme with a new particle type persists the selection and it remains selected after a page refresh.
User-facing labels are in English and are readable (e.g., title-cased names).

requirements.text: Implement distinct canvas rendering behaviors in `ParticleEffectLayer` for all particle types that are selectable in the admin UI, including the existing options that are currently not visually distinct (e.g., `confetti`, `stethoscopeParticles`, `crossParticles`) and the newly added types.

quotes: Add more particles types in the hero section theme to select.

acceptanceCriteria: Each selectable particle type results in a visibly different particle style/shape/motion (not falling back to the generic circle rendering).
Selecting any supported particle type does not throw runtime errors in the hero section.
If an unknown/unsupported `effectType` is encountered, the particle layer falls back gracefully to a default rendering (no crash).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in `backend/main.mo` (no additional backend services).
Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or the immutable hook paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Adding new sections to the landing page unrelated to hero theme configuration.
Introducing third-party particle libraries; keep the particle system canvas-based within the existing `ParticleEffectLayer` approach.
